abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Post Tsunami
            Reconstruction Project is to ensure that activities under
            the reconstruction operations will address the: 1) enhance
            positive and sustainable environmental and social outcomes;
            2) support the integration of environmental and social
            aspects of subprojects into the decision making process; 3)
            minimize environmental degradation as a result of either
            individual subprojects or their cumulative effects; and 4)
            protect human health.  The project is anticipated to have
            minor and localized environmental impacts coming mainly from
            civil works activities related to the construction of
            cyclone-resistant housing units and retrofitting of
            partially damaged housing and buildings. The types of
            environmental issues that may arise relate to land clearing
            for site preparation, movement of workers, and materials to
            and from project sites, and proper disposal of waste and
            debris. The reconstruction of the housing units will take
            place within the existing village boundaries and the units
            are designed to be low-cost but cyclone resistant. They are
            to be constructed mainly of legally imported timber and
            materials, requiring only light civil works. Some
            construction of the housing will occur in newly prepared
            sites and will involve some clearance of bush and vegetation
            for foundation preparation. Land has been identified and is
            primarily a plantation land of mixed use.
